intro: Mosiera moana, commonly known as the ocean hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a shrub that typically grows near coastal areas, thriving in sandy soils and salty air. The plant features showy, violet to purple flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth, waxy texture. Mosiera moana plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for local wildlife.
